result.execSummary:
The defendant Rina Leann Molla was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rina Leann Molla is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rina Leann Molla was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Rina Leann Molla was found guilty of Possess drug paraphernalia. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:36 AM Defendant Rina Leann Molla in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Rina Leann Molla.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Att Hoffman Count 2 will be amended to county ordinance possess paraph. fine $326.50
State- on ct. 1 4 1/2 years WSP imposed and stayed, structured as 3 years initial confinement and 18 months extended supervision, in favor of 3 years probation to run concurrent with Ashland County case 21CF237. If revoked, prison would be consecutive to any other sentence. Conditions of 45 days jail, 45 days credit. Court costs.
Att Hoffman agrees
Defendant pleads guilty to ct 1
Court questions defendant, finds plea is voluntary, judgment entered on ct. 1.  Ct 2 is amended as requested. accepts no contest plea on ct 2, fined $326.50. Count 3 is dismissed.  on ct. 1 4 1/2 years WSP imposed and stayed, structured as 3 years initial confinement and 18 months extended supervision, in favor of 3 years probation to run concurrent with Ashland County case 21CF237. If revoked, prison would be consecutive to any other sentence. Conditions of extended supervision programming as per DOC. Eligible for both programs. Conditions of probation 45 days jail, 45 days credit. Court costs. Programming as per DOC. Pay as per pay plan.
Att Hoffman- She will be released today.

3:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Angela M Wilson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rina Leann Molla appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court by video for Rina Leann Molla. Attorney Hoffman notes prior bail reduction to $750 cash bail and defendant was unable to post that amount. Asks for a further reduction, defendant could post $350 to $400 cash bail. Attorney Hoffman states contacts are mainly in the Ashland area. State reviews the prior modification. Defendant failed to appear in 2021 Ashland Co and in 2020 fta on signature bond. State is opposed to bail reduction and if Court amends asks no less than $500 cash bail. Court denies bail modification.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

3:17pm Defendant Rina Leann Molla in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Rina Leann Molla.  Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Hoffman makes argument in support of bail reduction. Defendant does not believe she is going to be revoked from probation; will be on a 30 day sanction. Believes she might be able to post 750cb, request the modification down to $750.
State-not opposed to modification down to $750
fta's in the past across 3 different ashland files; once cash was posted it doesn't appear that there was any ftas.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.pdf

10:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rina Leann Molla in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Rina Leann Molla. 
Att Hoffman- Client will waive prelim
Court finds she has waived prelim. Finds probable cause for bindover. Sets date. Reminds her of bond conditions
Arraignment scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:40 PM Defendant Rina Leann Molla appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Hoffman appears with Defendant. Court calls case.  Address verified as 630 Sanborn Ave, Ashland, WI 54806.  Receives complaint, waives reading, pleads not guilty, asks for preliminary.  Court accepts not guilty pleas. State requests $750 cash. Conditions of no use or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Has open Ashland case. Cites previous cases and prior FTA's. 
Attorney Hoffman indicates lives in Ashland last 10 years, has friends and family in Douglas County. No money to post.
Court orders $1500 cash, with conditions of no use or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:45 am.
